Handling Security Issues with PVCS

When you use the Windows client to open a project that wraps PVCS archives, you are asked to log onto PVCS when you perform an operation that accesses an archive.

If you access a PVCS archive from the Cross-Platform client, you will see a message indicating that a logon failure has occurred unless the PVCS password is either blank or the same as your StarTeam password.

If you access a PVCS archive from the View Comparison utility, you will see a logon failure message. To rectify this problem, use the Windows client, open the wrapped project view, press F6 and log on. Then you can return to the View Comparison utility. When you open a project that wraps a PVCS project, you must log onto PVCS. If your first access is from another client or from a utility that does not request a user name and password, you will receive a message indicating that a log-on failure has occurred.

When StarTeam prompts a user for a PVCS password, this password is sent over the connection with the same level of encryption as other data. Therefore, it is important that the connection be encrypted on the server.

Note: When StarTeam requests a PVCS password, it may also ask you to repeat your last command.
